New Records: Florian Wirtz scored Germany's fastest international goal after seven seconds, breaking Lukas Podolski's previous record of a seven-second goal against Ecuador in 2013.
Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz scored the opening goal for Germany in the first minute of the match. Kai Havertz scored the second goal for Germany early in the second half.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann was desperate for a good start to the year ahead of the Euro 2024 tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany's coach Julian Nagelsmann was satisfied with the team's performance and described it as a confidence boost. France's coach Didier Deschamps admitted that his team was below par and took responsibility for the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Germany's first win in their last four games.
Others: The match was played at the Groupama Stadium in Lyon, France, and was attended by 56,000 spectators.
